intro: Megalastrum adenopteris, commonly known as the velvet leaf. It is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, characterized by its large, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a distinctive fragrance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique appearance.
